channel.title: How can I use notepad++ for coding server?
channel.description:
I used to use old notepad.., when I downloaded new notepad++, I seen very MUCH BETTER than my old notepad! :D
But.. when I right-click my client.java, and clicked "open with" and I browse to my desktop, and click on Notepad++, but the error alert cames: [code]C:\Documents and Settings\Dana\Desktop\LiveScape Source\client.java is not a valid Win32 appliction.[/code] Please help! :( How can I get notepad++ working with my sources file? :(
NOTE: I don't want to paste everything from notepad to notepad++ then edit, then paste back to notepad, then save. o.O

item.title: How can I use notepad++ for coding server?
item.dc:creator: @Exist2inspire Exist2inspire
item.description:
@Exist2inspire wrote:

Java_Coffee™:

er… that mean i can’t use notepad++ to edit in source?

yes, you can, as i said, its a replacement for notepad. so that means it does everything your old notepad used to do + more.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I use notepad++ for coding server?

item.title: How can I use notepad++ for coding server?
item.dc:creator: @newservermaker newservermaker
item.description:
@newservermaker wrote:

i dont sugest useing notepad++ or anything to deal with it… use J# from microsoft, much better and you can take java to the next level becouse J# is beyond java. that or use J creator LE which can be foudn on google. both are far better then anything to deal with notepad, the problem you have is that your short cut cant find the specified redirection, aka, you took it out of yur documents and it cant be found in there, remake the shortcut or redownload notepad ++

Read full topic
item.source: How can I use notepad++ for coding server?

item.title: How can I use notepad++ for coding server?

item.description:
@squal707 wrote:

do what i said go into notpad ++ then file open then chose client.java or whatever you want to edit should work that way

item.title: How can I use notepad++ for coding server?
item.dc:creator: @Exist2inspire Exist2inspire
item.description:
@Exist2inspire wrote:

notpad ++ is just an extension of notepad… it just helps you whilst your scripting, for example, if you comment something (//) the text will be green. basically, it just recognizes various languages and helps you when your scripting.

Read full topic
